alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 5:57PM MST until August 15 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 900 PM MST. * At 553 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across a large area along and south of SR 264, along and east of SR 77, across US 191 and north of Interstate 40. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greasewood Springs, Sunrise Springs, Indian Wells, Cornfields Chapter House, Klagetoh, Wide Ruins, Petrified Forest National Park, Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site, Greasewood and Ganado. This includes the following highways... State Route 77 between mile markers 405 and 408. State Route 264 between mile markers 446 and 448. Highway 191 between mile markers 385 and 411. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Digger Wash, Bent Knee Wash, Oak Ridge Wash, Crazy Creek, Big Dam Wash, Leroux Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Sabito Wash, Wildhorse Wash, Coyote Wash, West Twin Wash, Wide Ruin Wash, East Twin Wash, Lithodendron Wash, Steamboat Wash, Puerco River, Dead Wash, Little Lithodendron Wash and Bidahochi Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
